article.headline: Long Island U. 72, St. Peter's 61
article.story: JERSEY CITY, N.J. (AP) -- Aubin Scott's 16 points and 12 rebounds led Long Island to a 72-61 victory over St. Peter's Sunday. James Williams and Tyrone Mattison scored 13 points each for the Blackbirds (5-7), who had St. Peter's playing catch-up for most of the game and led by as many as 16 points. Evan Meekins added 14 points for Long Island. The loss was the fourth in a row for St. Peter's. Raul Orta led the Peacocks (3-9) with a game-high 24 points. Todd Sowell was the only other St. Peter's player to score in double digits, finishing with 15 points and 10 rebounds. St. Peter's took an early 12-11 lead, but the Blackbirds went on a 20-5 run in the second quarter and stayed in control for the rest of the game. The Peacocks cut Long Island's advantage to eight points with four minutes left in the game, but the Blackbirds pulled it back up to 13 points with a minute remaining.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
